Class ChSet 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ChSet
public class ChSet
extends Object
Class for "creating and massagin sets of characters".

Author:
Ethan Georgi

ChSet(String)
Construct-o-rama!

display()
Display the set.
getSet()
in(char)
Is this character in the set?
include(char)
Include a new character to the set.
setLength()
How long is the set?
setSet(ChSet)
Assign a new set.
union(ChSet, ChSet)
Add two ChSets together and return the result.

ChSet 
 public ChSet(String s)
Construct-o-rama!

Parameters:
s, - The set of characters to begin with.

setLength 
 public int setLength()
How long is the set?

Returns:
The length of the set of characters.
setSet 
 public void setSet(ChSet c)
Assign a new set.

Parameters:
c, - The new set of characters.
getSet 
 public String getSet()
in 
 public boolean in(char ch)
Is this character in the set?

Parameters:
ch, - The character to look for in the set
include 
 public void include(char ch)
Include a new character to the set.

Parameters:
ch, - The new character to include
union 
 public ChSet union(ChSet c1,
                    ChSet c2)
Add two ChSets together and return the result. Note that the resulting union removes duplicate characters.

Parameters:
c1, - The first ChSet
c2, - The second ChSet
Returns:
The resulting union of c1 and c2.
display 
 public void display()
Display the set.
